name: Disney's All-Star Movies

reviews.text: Room was clean, pools were great, daughter enjoyed all the visually stimulating aspects of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great for price an location

reviews.text: Dining in hotel cafeteria was ok and what you should expect in cafeteria environment.
reviews.title: Better than I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Transportation to parks was quick and we never waited long.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: I was underwhelmed by the front desk and concierge staffs friendliness - I expected more but it was fine.
reviews.title: Room was clean and nice, but Wifi stinks.

reviews.text: Twice we had great experiences in cafeteria..... Ana made my daughters day with a special Mickey straw and cup because it was her birthday and another young lady saw my daughter having a meltdown because she wanted the balloons tied to register so she let we have them .
reviews.title: Family Trip

reviews.text: If you want Disney on a budget this is your resort. The rooms are small, the washroom is tiny but you are on Disney property with all the perks. The rooms do not have a balcony, its your typical motel style rooms but if you know thats what you ae getting, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: For a Value Resort Its Great

reviews.text: We were there for the race weekend with friends, it was a great place to stay on budget!
reviews.title: Love This Resort!

reviews.text: I recently had a short trip to Walt Disney World and decided to stay at All Star Movies for the 3rd time.
reviews.title: Awesome resort

reviews.text: I love this resort! I'm a movie buff so to see all the larger than life movie icons is amazing.
reviews.title: Great for saving some money.

reviews.text: I was staying in the 101 Dalmatians wing. In front of the 2 buildings were giant statues of Pongo and Purdie (the two adult dogs from the movie) and the stairwells were fire hydrants. The area between the two buildings had the sidewalk made to look like red white and blue dog treats. Also there was a puppy sitting in front of a TV that guests could get behind for a photo op. My favorite part was paw prints in the concrete making it look like a puppy walked in the concrete before it dried.
reviews.title: It's great for what it is...a kid-themed motel style hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had stayed at a moderate resort before and so we were a little disappointed. We paid to have a " prefered " room, well our room was a long walk away from the lobby/food court,bus stop, also requested a king bed, got 2 full sized beds. Bummer, we called desk, well it seems the king rooms are handicap rooms, all full. I was not told there was no chance of getting a king room when I booked. We slept together the first night but bed was way too small. The room was quiet but small. Vanity area small. Chairs had rips, scribble marks on wall, worn carpet. If you stay at a value resort you stop at all 3 to pick up and drop off people. It took us over an hour to get to airport, stopped at 3 other resorts to load people and luggage, but it is free,besides tips.I would not stay there again.Walt would be sad, I wasn't feeling the magic. Especially when all the gift shops were full of made in China stuff and $30 T-shirts.
reviews.title: Ok

reviews.text: First of all I want to start by saying, we chose somewhere else to stay for our trip, and the place we chose was horrible...So for $10 more a night stayed at Disney's All-Star Movie Resort, and our vacation became wonderful! This was an awesome place to stay! Food on-site, drinks (soda, alcohol, coffee, juice, milk) what ever you wanted all on site! Free transportation to all the major Disney World Attractions, free ride to and from the airport. If I would have know all this, I would not have rented a rental car or chose any where else to stay. This place was clean, the staff was friendly and it was a great price!
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: This is the forth year in a row to stay at a "value" resort for the Disney system. The resort it self is very clean, well organized and offer the Disney Transportation system to all parks, and Downtown Disney. The room was very clean, and we had housekeeping service every day with out any problems. While we were out, Housekeeping came in and took care of our room. We had Breakfast each morning at the resort and dinner at one of the many restaurants that were located on our "park of the day" tour. I can say that this property or any of the All-Star resorts are great for a family, I suggest the dinning plan, and ask questions from reservations before booking your vacation. We book our vacations each year on line, and this includes making dinner reservations.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel directly from Disney resort website with seasonal promotion. The price was good considered the package included airport pick-up & theme park shuttle. But room was simple and bit outdated. However, the housekeeping and the front desk staff made us feeling better. The hotel food court was bit pricy. But milk price sold in the gift shop was fair market price. If you spent extra money for preferred room option on website, you may stay at toy story area with woody & Buzz.
reviews.title: Value for money holiday!

reviews.text: We highly recommend to book this hotel directly through Disney website. They will offer big discount on room price from time to time.Also you will receive extra gift-ex. Luggage tags & coupons. Make sure to inform them your flight schedule. It was awesome to get airline boarding pass at hotel.
reviews.title: Quick Trip Vaca Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love Walt Disney World. I think it is worth the extra few dollars to stay in a hotel in the Disney Complex. The cheapest rooms are the All Star resorts (Sports, Music, Movies). The rooms are just adequate. Two double beds and a small bath, cable TV, Nothing exotic. The beds were comfortable and the bed linens were fine. The room was clean but a little dated. However, the beauty of these hotels is the transportation system that allows you to park your car when you arrive and forget about it until it's time to leave. We stayed 3 nights and never used the car once. Just outside the main entrance is a bus stop with 5 or 6 different destination lines. You can take a bus to any of the 4 major amusement parks or the two water parks. There is never a long wait and the busses are handicap accesible. A handicapped friend told me that Disney World is the most accessible place he has ever visited. Our hotel was 10 separate three story buldings with 30 rooms per building. They are no different than a Days Innor other budget hotel. They were all situated around a nice swimming pool. The main lobby had a cafeteria, gift shop and other services. You spend so little time in the hotel, I don't understand the benefit of spending $400 per night at one of the nicer hotels, when this one charged around $125 per night. Spend the money you save on park tickets which are fairly expensive (@ $90). We plan to return with grandchildren next year and will stay in one of the All Star Resorts again.
reviews.title: Cheap rooms in Walt Disney World

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and beautifully themed. Although the wait in the guest assistance line could be long it was because they would go above and beyond to help you out. We had a package delivered to the hotel ahead of time and one of the managers delivered it to us in our room when it wasn't ready on check in.
reviews.title: Awesome holiday

reviews.text: I found a great deal for $109 per night for this hotel. I went with my mom on a mother- daughter getaway. Booked online no problem. Disney's Magical Express from MCO was good, despite a long wait in the terminal and then 3 stops at other hotels before stopping at All Star Movies. Requested a room close to lobby/ transportation. We were assigned a room in the Herbie the Love Bug buildings (there are two- we were in building 7) A bit of a far walk especially dragging bags and for my mother who is older.
reviews.title: Great price but showing its age- some pixie dust is needed ;-)

reviews.text: Had a small little problem upon check in. We had ordered some groceries to be delivered to our room by a company called Strollers and Groceries. S&G confirmed that our items were delivered to the bell stand and even sent me a text message to confirm but when we checked in they were nowhere to be found. The bell staff checked a list for us and didn't see our name. There were about 4 or 5 cast members standing up there but not one of them took any extra effort in checking to see if they were there in the back somewhere. I decided to just give up and go to the room- perhaps they were sent there. Nothing! I called S&G and they confirmed the delivery again and said they could even tell me what shelf they were put on in the bell closet. S&G even called the bellstand for me. After a few minutes of not hearing anything I called and reached Stephanie who finally said that she would send our stuff to our room. So many calls and unnecessary frustration- if only someone could have gone in the back and checked. I was a little surprised as Disney cast members in the past have always gone above and beyond.
reviews.title: OK Hotel
Just as good second time around
reviews.text: Our room was basically fine but bare bones. Typical room of what you would find at a Courtyard/ Holiday Inn. There was a refrigerator but that was about it. No coffee maker. The carpet was terribly worn. My mom even commented on it. I know it is a value resort but I am still surprised as everything else in Disney is top shelf.

description: Disney's All-Star Movies Resort is a Disney Value Resort hotel featuring giant icons that salute classic Disney films—including Disney·Pixar's Toy Story, Fantasia, The Love Bug, The Mighty Ducks and One Hundred and One Dalmatians.
